lines.text: [after tying Gene to a chair, Mary and Larry prepare to flee an approaching posse]
Hey, wait a minute! Get me out of this steer's necktie and I'll help cloud your trail.
Why should we trust you?
Why, Ed's ghost would haunt me if I let them hang the wrong man.
I'll take your six-shooter.
Now look here, Cramer...
Just to make sure you mind your own business. I don't wear this badge for fun, you know.
Quit stalling. Where's Larry Evans?
Say, that reminds me, Randall. Weren't you in that dice game when Norton was killed.
That's right. So were Harper and Mason.
Now, Gene, you don't think one of us daylighted Ed?
Just gonna make some java. Care to join me?
Not me - your coffee'd throw a horseshoe. Hope I don't see you in jail.
[the Sheriff doubles back to check on Gene's story]
What are you doin', Sheriff? Playin' injun?
You see a lot of things that way sometimes. Besides, if Mary's with her brother, Gene could have been coverin' for her. He's a sucker for a lady in distress.
Say, by the way, if you didn't plug Norton, how come he was killed with your gun?
I ran out of dough and I put in my gun to stay in the game.
Like this one?
Yeah. I *had* a pair of 'em.
You were out to make yourself a reputation, weren't you? You certainly did. It's too bad - that sort of dime-store hero went out with Billy the Kid.
[Gene lays his handkerchief on the ground]
What are you doin'?
Puttin' my ear to the ground. It's an old Indian scout trick. Silk picks up sound... Wagon comin'.
Get out of those clothes!
What?
You heard me. Chuck the duds and get in the creek!
In the creek? But it's ice water! You wanna give me pneumonia?
Yeah, but you'll catch lead poisoning if they catch you in that gray check shirt, riding a palomino.
Good morning, Miss Mary. Great day for the race.
What race?
The human race.
How's Larry? Have you heard anything from him yet? It's too bad he skipped town. It would have helped his case if he hung around and let the law take its course.
With Judge Lynch presiding?
By the way, Miss Mary, you and your brother didn't happen to run into a fellow named Gene Autry did you?
Gene Autry?
Yeah, he's a friend of mine. Nice fella, too, if he's on your side. Different story if he's on t'other.
Gene, I'd like to borrow that pistol from you if you don't mind.
Now look here, Sheriff...
It might go off accidental-like and hurt somebody.
All right. Remember that's two you owe me.
I'm keepin' count.
Gene, I'll take...
[points to Gene's gunbelt]
All right... I know.
The ladies say they're not comfortable to dance with.
I'm givin' you a chance, Autry.
Why you cheap imitation of a leather-slapper. I oughta turn you over to Cramer just to teach you a lesson.
Draw or I'll plug ya.
Give me that cap pistol before I use it to part your hair!
Jim, somebody wants this ranch... wants it bad enough to commit murder. Now what could be here that would pay a man enough to risk his neck for it.
Nothin'.
Hold on now, Jim...
I don't haveta. I been over this country hundreds of times.
No gold?
Ohhh, maybe enough to fill your tooth.
No silver?
Welll, might find enough to plate a watch.
You sure there's nothing here?
Are you crazy in the head? I've been prospecting these parts ever since the Apaches were takin' potshots at everything that was movin'...
[chuckles]
That is, everything but coyotes. It's bad luck to shoot your own relatives.
Jim, I want you to take Larry and keep him under cover until you hear from me.
Oh, I couldn't ask Mr. Hedges to take a risk like that.
You didn't!
[points to Gene]
He did.
[Sheriff Cramer fires at the murderer who attempts to escape on Gene's horse]
Hold it, Sheriff!
But he's got your horse!
That's his hard luck.
[Gene whistles and Champion wheels and returns the killer to the posse]
[last lines]
Come on down, fella. We got a certain judge we want you to meet.
What the sam hill is going on here?
We were playing "post office".
But that's a kid's game.
Not the way we play it.
